biography: On 11 March 2006, former Yugoslav president Slobodan Milošević died in his prison cell of a heart attack at age 64 while being tried for war crimes at the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia (ICTY) in The Hague. Milošević's four-year trial had been a major international news story, and he died a few months before its verdict was due. His death occurred shortly after the Tribunal rejected his request to seek specialized medical treatment at a cardiology clinic in Moscow. A report published on 30 May 2006 confirmed that he had died of natural causes and that there was "no poison or other chemical substance found in his body that contributed to the death".

## Dr. Leo Bokeria: A Biography

### 3. Key Procedures & Clinical Expertise

As a cardiac surgeon, Dr. Bokeria possesses a broad range of technical skills and clinical expertise in the management of various cardiovascular diseases. His proficiency likely extends to the following key procedures:

*   **Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting (CABG):** This procedure involves grafting healthy blood vessels to bypass blocked coronary arteries, restoring blood flow to the heart muscle. Dr. Bokeria likely performs both on-pump CABG, utilizing a heart-lung machine to temporarily take over the function of the heart and lungs, and off-pump CABG, performing the surgery on the beating heart. He likely possesses expertise in selecting the optimal grafting vessels (e.g., saphenous vein, internal mammary artery) and employing advanced techniques to minimize complications and optimize long-term patency of the grafts.

*   **Valve Repair and Replacement:** Dr. Bokeria likely performs surgical interventions to repair or replace damaged heart valves, including the aortic, mitral, tricuspid, and pulmonary valves. He likely utilizes both mechanical and bioprosthetic valves, carefully considering the patient's age, lifestyle, and medical history when selecting the appropriate valve type. He likely possesses expertise in minimally invasive valve surgery, utilizing smaller incisions and specialized instruments to reduce trauma and accelerate recovery.

*   **Aortic Aneurysm Repair:** Dr. Bokeria likely performs surgical repair of aortic aneurysms, which are abnormal bulges in the aorta, the body's largest artery. He likely utilizes both open surgical techniques, involving a large incision to access the aorta, and endovascular techniques, utilizing catheters and stents to reinforce the weakened vessel. He likely possesses expertise in managing complex aortic aneurysms, including those involving the aortic arch and thoracoabdominal aorta.

*   **Congenital Heart Defect Correction:** Dr. Bokeria likely performs surgical correction of congenital heart defects, which are abnormalities present at birth. These defects can range from simple atrial septal defects (ASD) to more complex conditions such as tetralogy of Fallot. He likely collaborates with pediatric cardiologists and other specialists to provide comprehensive care for patients with congenital heart disease.

His clinical expertise likely extends beyond the technical aspects of surgery to encompass the pre-operative evaluation, intra-operative management, and post-operative care of cardiac surgery patients. He likely possesses a deep understanding of cardiac physiology, pathophysiology, and pharmacology, enabling him to effectively manage complex medical conditions and optimize patient outcomes.
